        h ^= s.charCodeAt(i);
      }
      return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
    }

    function charNameToID() {
      const n = document.getElementById('charName').value;
      charNameOut.textContent = n
        ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}`
        : 'Enter a name.';
    }
    function charIDToName() {
      const raw = document.getElementById('charID').value.trim();
      if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw))
        return charIDOut.textContent = 'Enter a valid integer ID.';
      const target = parseInt(raw,10);
      const candidates = document.getElementById('charList').value
                           .split('\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean);
      const hits = candidates.filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
      charIDOut.textContent = hits.length
        ? hits.join('\n')
        : 'No matches found.';
    }

    function toggleDropdown() {
      document.getElementById('pickerDropdown').classList.toggle('open');
    }

    function colNameToID() {
      const input = document.getElementById('colName').value.trim();
      const name = input.startsWith('#') ? input : ('#'+input);
      if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name))
        return colNameOut.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB';
      const r = parseInt(name.slice(1,3),16),
            g = parseInt(name.slice(3,5),16),
            b = parseInt(name.slice(5,7),16);
      const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
      const s = (u & 0x80000000) ? u - 0x100000000 : u;
      colNameOut.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
    }

    function colIDToHex() {
      const raw = document.getElementById('colID').value.trim();
      if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw))
        return colIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.';
      const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed >>> 0;
      const hexFull = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0');
      const hex = hexFull.slice(6,8)+hexFull.slice(4,6)+hexFull.slice(2,4);
      colIDOut.innerHTML =
        `${signed} = #${hex}\nPreview: <span id="swatch" class="small-color"></span>`;
      document.getElementById('swatch').style.backgroundColor = `#${hex}`;
    }

    document.getElementById('imageLoader').addEventListener('change', function(e) {
      const file = e.target.files[0], reader = new FileReader();
      reader.onload = ev => {
        const img = new Image();
        img.onload = () => {
          const c = document.getElementById('imageCanvas'),
                ctx = c.getContext('2d'),
                maxDim = document.getElementById('colName').clientWidth * 0.66;
          let [w,h] = [img.width, img.height];
          const scale = Math.min(maxDim/w, maxDim/h, 1);
          c.width = w*scale;
          c.height = h*scale;
          ctx.drawImage(img,0,0,c.width,c.height);
        };
        img.src = ev.target.result;
      };
      if (file) reader.readAsDataURL(file);
    });

    document.getElementById('imageCanvas').addEventListener('click', function(e) {
      const ctx = this.getContext('2d'), rect = this.getBoundingClientRect(),
            x = e.clientX-rect.left, y = e.clientY-rect.top,
            [r,g,b] = ctx.getImageData(x,y,1,1).data;
      const hex = "#" + [r,g,b].map(v=>v.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join('');
      document.getElementById('colName').value = hex;
      colNameToID();
    });
  </script>

</body>
</html>

The preview swatch now matches the color picker’s triple‐border look exactly.

You said:
Is there a way to make the image picker support dds files and also files that have a ".TEX" format in the name but are actually dds
ChatGPT said:

You can absolutely extend your “eyedropper” to also handle .dds (and “.TEX” files that are really DDS) by:

  1. Allowing those extensions on the <input>

  2. Reading the file as an ArrayBuffer, detecting DDS, and

  3. Using a tiny JS DDS‐decoder to turn it into an RGBA image you can draw on your <canvas>.

Below is a drop-in patch for your tool:

html
<!-- replace your file‐input and script code with this: -->
<label for="imageLoader">Image eyedropper:</label><br/>
<input type="file" id="imageLoader" accept=".dds,.DDS,.tex,.TEX,image/*" />

<!-- include a DDS loader before your main script: -->
<script type="module">
  import { DDSLoader } from 'https://unpkg.com/three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

  const loader = new DDSLoader();

  document.getElementById('imageLoader').addEventListener('change', async e => {
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    if (!file) return;
    const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
    const isDDS = ext === 'dds' || ext === 'tex';

    const arrayBuffer = await file.arrayBuffer();
    let imageData;

    if (isDDS) {
      // Decode DDS to a DataTexture
      const texture = loader.parse(arrayBuffer, true);
      // texture.image.width/height, texture.image.data (Uint8Array in RGBA)
      const { width, height } = texture.image;
      imageData = new ImageData(
        new Uint8ClampedArray(texture.image.data),
        width, height
      );
    } else {
      // Fallback for PNG/JPG/etc.
      const img = new Image();
      img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
      await img.decode();
      const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
      canvas.width = img.width; canvas.height = img.height;
      canvas.getContext('2d').drawImage(img, 0, 0);
      imageData = canvas.getContext('2d').getImageData(0,0,canvas.width,canvas.height);
    }

    // Draw into your onscreen canvas
    const c = document.getElementById('imageCanvas');
    const ctx = c.getContext('2d');
    // scale to fit 2/3 size as before
    const maxDim = document.getElementById('colName').clientWidth * 0.66;
    const scale = Math.min(maxDim/imageData.width, maxDim/imageData.height, 1);
    c.width  = imageData.width * scale;
    c.height = imageData.height * scale;
    // putImageData doesn’t scale, so use an offscreen canvas
    const off = document.createElement('canvas');
    off.width = imageData.width; off.height = imageData.height;
    off.getContext('2d').putImageData(imageData, 0,0);
    ctx.drawImage(off, 0, 0, c.width, c.height);
  });
</script>

How it works

  • accept=".dds,.tex,image/*" tells the browser to allow DDS and TEX files alongside normal images.

  • We read everything via file.arrayBuffer() so binary .dds data isn’t corrupted.

  • If the extension is .dds or .tex, we hand the buffer to Three.js’s DDSLoader (zero‐config via unpkg), which spits back a WebGL DataTexture. We grab its raw RGBA and wrap it into a standard ImageData.

  • Otherwise (PNG/JPG), we fall back to the usual <img> → draw → getImageData.

  • Finally we draw (and scale) into your existing <canvas id="imageCanvas">, unifying both pipelines.

Drop that snippet into your page (making sure your page is served via HTTP(s) so the ES module can load), and your eyedropper will now understand .dds and “.tex that are really DDS,” exactly as you wanted.

Here’s your full index.html, now with DDS/.TEX support baked in. It accepts .dds, .DDS, .tex, .TEX (plus normal images), decodes DDS via Three.js’s DDSLoader module, and draws/eyedrops as before. Everything else—including the native color‐picker preview—remains exactly as you specified.

  <script type="module">
    import { DDSLoader } from 'https://unpkg.com/three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

    // FNV-1 hash
    function fnv1(name) {
      let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
      for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
        h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
        h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
      }
      return (h & 0x80000000)? h - 0x100000000 : h;
    }

    // Character handlers
    window.charNameToID = () => {
      const n = document.getElementById('charName').value;
      charNameOut.textContent = n
        ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}`
        : 'Enter a name.';
    };
    window.charIDToName = () => {
      const raw = document.getElementById('charID').value.trim();
      if (!/^-?\\d+$/.test(raw)) {
        charIDOut.textContent = 'Enter a valid integer ID.'; return;
      }
      const target = parseInt(raw,10);
      const candidates = document.getElementById('charList').value
        .split('\\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean);
      const hits = candidates.filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
      charIDOut.textContent = hits.length? hits.join('\\n') : 'No matches found.';
    };

    // Dropdown toggle
    window.toggleDropdown = () =>
      pickerDropdown.classList.toggle('open');

    // Color hex → Tint ID
    window.colNameToID = () => {
      const inp = colName.value.trim(),
            name = inp.startsWith('#')? inp : '#' + inp;
      if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
        colNameOut.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
      }
      const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i=>parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
      const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
      const s = (u&0x80000000)? u-0x100000000 : u;
      colNameOut.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
    };

    // ID → Hex + Preview
    window.colIDToHex = () => {
      const raw = colID.value.trim();
      if (!/^-?\\d+$/.test(raw)) {
        colIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
      }
      const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed>>>0;
      const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0'),
            hex  = full.slice(6)+full.slice(4,6)+full.slice(2,4);
      colIDOut.innerHTML =
        `${signed} = #${hex}\\nPreview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
      swatch.value = `#${hex}`;
    };

    // Image loader (DDS/.tex + standard)
    const ddsLoader = new DDSLoader();
    imageLoader.addEventListener('change', async e => {
      const file = e.target.files[0];
      if (!file) return;
      const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
      const buf = await file.arrayBuffer();
      let imageData, w, h;

      if (ext==='dds'||ext==='tex') {
        const tex = ddsLoader.parse(buf, true);
        w = tex.image.width; h = tex.image.height;
        imageData = new ImageData(
          new Uint8ClampedArray(tex.image.data), w, h);
      } else {
        const img = new Image();
        img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
        await img.decode();
        const off = document.createElement('canvas');
        off.width = img.width; off.height = img.height;
        off.getContext('2d').drawImage(img,0,0);
        w = off.width; h = off.height;
        imageData = off.getContext('2d').getImageData(0,0,w,h);
      }

      const c = imageCanvas, ctx = c.getContext('2d'),
            maxDim = colName.clientWidth*0.66,
            scale = Math.min(maxDim/w, maxDim/h,1);
      c.width = w*scale; c.height = h*scale;

      const off2 = document.createElement('canvas');
      off2.width = w; off2.height = h;
      off2.getContext('2d').putImageData(imageData,0,0);
      ctx.drawImage(off2,0,0,c.width,c.height);
    });

    // Eyedropper click
    imageCanvas.addEventListener('click', e => {
      const ctx = imageCanvas.getContext('2d'),
            rect = imageCanvas.getBoundingClientRect(),
            x = e.clientX-rect.left, y = e.clientY-rect.top,
            [r,g,b] = ctx.getImageData(x,y,1,1).data;
      const hex = '#'+[r,g,b].map(v=>v.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join('');
      colName.value=hex; colNameToID();
    });
  </script>

</body>
</html>

Just save this over your existing file, and you’ll be able to drop in DDS/TEX textures as well as standard images for the eyedropper. ​​

      vertical-align:middle;

      display:block; margin:0.5em auto;
      border:1px solid #ccc; cursor:crosshair;

    #cc { display:none; }

<body>

  <!-- CHARACTER TOOL -->
  <section>
    <h2>Characters IDs</h2>
    <label>Name → ID</label>
    <input id="charName" type="text" placeholder="e.g. IRONMANMARK6" />
    <button onclick="charNameToID()">Get ID</button>
    <pre id="charNameOut"></pre>
    <hr/>
    <label>ID → Name (This requires a list of possible names.)</label>
    <input id="charID" type="text" placeholder="e.g. -2138279224" />
    <textarea id="charList" rows="4" placeholder="Paste one name per line…"></textarea>
    <button onclick="charIDToName()">Find Matches</button>
    <pre id="charIDOut"></pre>
  </section>

  <!-- COLOR TOOL -->
  <section>
    <h2>Color (Tint) IDs</h2>
    <label>Color hex code → Tint ID</label>
    <input id="colName" type="text" placeholder="#RRGGBB" />
    <div class="dropdown" id="pickerDropdown">
      <button class="toggle-btn" onclick="toggleDropdown()">
        Advanced picker <span class="triangle">▼</span>
      </button>
      <div class="dropdown-content">
        <label for="colorPicker">Color picker:</label><br/>
        <input type="color" id="colorPicker" class="small-color"
               onchange="colName.value=this.value; colNameToID()" /><br/>
        <label for="imageLoader">Image eyedropper:</label><br/>
        <input type="file" id="imageLoader"
               accept=".dds,.DDS,.tex,.TEX,image/*" />
        <canvas id="imageCanvas"></canvas>
      </div>
    </div>
    <button onclick="colNameToID()">Get Tint ID</button>
    <pre id="colNameOut"></pre>
    <hr/>
    <label>ID → Hex code + preview</label>
    <input id="colID" type="text" placeholder="e.g. -5744098" />
    <button onclick="colIDToHex()">Show Hex & Preview</button>
    <pre id="colIDOut"></pre>
  </section>

  <canvas id="cc"></canvas>

  <script type="module">
    import { DDSLoader } from 'https://unpkg.com/three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

    // FNV-1 hash
    function fnv1(name) {
      let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
      for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
        h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
        h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
      }
      return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
    }

    // Global handlers
    window.charNameToID = () => {
      const n = document.getElementById('charName').value;
      document.getElementById('charNameOut').textContent =
        n ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}` : 'Enter a name.';
    };
    window.charIDToName = () => {
      const raw = document.getElementById('charID').value.trim();
      const out = document.getElementById('charIDOut');
      if (!/^-?\\d+$/.test(raw)) {
        out.textContent = 'Enter a valid integer ID.'; return;
      }
      const target = parseInt(raw,10);
      const candidates = document.getElementById('charList').value
        .split('\\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean);
      const hits = candidates.filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
      out.textContent = hits.length ? hits.join('\\n') : 'No matches found.';
    };
    window.toggleDropdown = () => {
      document.getElementById('pickerDropdown').classList.toggle('open');
    };
    window.colNameToID = () => {
      const inp = document.getElementById('colName').value.trim();
      const name = inp.startsWith('#') ? inp : '#' + inp;
      const out = document.getElementById('colNameOut');
      if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
        out.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
      }
      const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i=>parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
      const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
      const s = (u & 0x80000000)? u-0x100000000 : u;
      out.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
    };
    window.colIDToHex = () => {
      const raw = document.getElementById('colID').value.trim();
      const out = document.getElementById('colIDOut');
      if (!/^-?\\d+$/.test(raw)) {
        out.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
      }
      const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed>>>0;
      const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0');
      const hex = full.slice(6)+full.slice(4,6)+full.slice(2,4);
      out.innerHTML =
        `${signed} = #${hex}\\nPreview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
      document.getElementById('swatch').value = `#${hex}`;
    };

    // DDS/.TEX + image loader
    const ddsLoader = new DDSLoader();
    document.getElementById('imageLoader').addEventListener('change', async e => {
      const file = e.target.files[0];
      if (!file) return;
      const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
      const buf = await file.arrayBuffer();
      let imageData, w, h;
      if (ext==='dds'||ext==='tex') {
        const tex = ddsLoader.parse(buf, true);
        w = tex.image.width; h = tex.image.height;
        imageData = new ImageData(new Uint8ClampedArray(tex.image.data), w, h);
      } else {
        const img = new Image();
        img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
        await img.decode();
        const off = document.createElement('canvas');
        off.width = img.width; off.height = img.height;
        off.getContext('2d').drawImage(img, 0, 0);
        w = off.width; h = off.height;
        imageData = off.getContext('2d').getImageData(0,0,w,h);
      }
      const c = document.getElementById('imageCanvas'), ctx = c.getContext('2d');
      const maxDim = document.getElementById('colName').clientWidth * 0.66;
      const scale = Math.min(maxDim/w, maxDim/h, 1);
      c.width = w*scale; c.height = h*scale;
      const off2 = document.createElement('canvas');
      off2.width = w; off2.height = h; off2.getContext('2d').putImageData(imageData,0,0);
      ctx.drawImage(off2,0,0,c.width,c.height);
    });
    // Eyedropper click
    document.getElementById('imageCanvas').addEventListener('click', e => {
      const c = document.getElementById('imageCanvas'), ctx = c.getContext('2d'),
            rect = c.getBoundingClientRect(),
            x = e.clientX-rect.left, y = e.clientY-rect.top;
      const [r,g,b] = ctx.getImageData(x,y,1,1).data;
      const hex = '#' + [r,g,b].map(v=>v.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join('');
      document.getElementById('colName').value = hex;
      colNameToID();
    });
  </script>

</body>
</html>

Still didn't work, i ended up copying this and putting it in my original file. Now the dropdown opens, but choosing a dds does nothing
ChatGPT said:

It turns out the browser won’t load ES-modules like import { DDSLoader } … when you just open the file via file://, so your .dds/.tex picks never hit the loader. The workaround is to include Three.js and the DDSLoader in classic <script> tags (which do work over file://) and then use THREE.DDSLoader. Here’s a drop-in replacement for your HTML’s bottom section—just swap in this snippet for your <script> blocks:

html
  <!-- after your </section> -->
  <canvas id="cc"></canvas>

  <!-- include Three + DDSLoader UMD scripts -->
  <script src="https://unpkg.com/three@0.154.0/build/three.min.js"></script>
  <script src="https://unpkg.com/three@0.154.0/examples/js/loaders/DDSLoader.js"></script>

  <!-- your existing helpers / handlers, but using THREE.DDSLoader -->
  <script>
    // FNV-1 hash (unchanged)
    function fnv1(name) {
      let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
      for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
        h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
        h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
      }
      return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
    }

    // Character converters (unchanged) …
    window.charNameToID = () => { /* … */ };
    window.charIDToName = () => { /* … */ };

    // Dropdown toggle, colNameToID, colIDToHex (unchanged) …

    // DDS/.tex + image loader:
    const ddsLoader = new THREE.DDSLoader();
    document.getElementById('imageLoader').addEventListener('change', async e => {
      const file = e.target.files[0];
      if (!file) return;

      const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
      const buffer = await file.arrayBuffer();
      let imgData, w, h;

      if (ext === 'dds' || ext === 'tex') {
        // parse DDS
        const tex = ddsLoader.parse(buffer, true);
        w = tex.image.width; h = tex.image.height;
        imgData = new ImageData(new Uint8ClampedArray(tex.image.data), w, h);
      } else {
        // standard image fallback
        const img = new Image();
        img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
        await img.decode();
        const off = document.createElement('canvas');
        off.width = img.width; off.height = img.height;
        off.getContext('2d').drawImage(img, 0, 0);
        w = off.width; h = off.height;
        imgData = off.getContext('2d').getImageData(0, 0, w, h);
      }

      // draw & scale to 2/3 width
      const canvas = document.getElementById('imageCanvas'), ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
      const maxDim = document.getElementById('colName').clientWidth * 0.66;
      const scale = Math.min(maxDim / w, maxDim / h, 1);
      canvas.width = w * scale; canvas.height = h * scale;

      // use offscreen to scale
      const off2 = document.createElement('canvas');
      off2.width = w; off2.height = h;
      off2.getContext('2d').putImageData(imgData, 0, 0);
      ctx.drawImage(off2, 0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
    });

    // eyedropper click (unchanged) …
    document.getElementById('imageCanvas').addEventListener('click', function(e) {
      /* … */
    });
  </script>

What changed:

  • We load three.min.js and examples/js/loaders/DDSLoader.js via <script> tags so they work straight off the filesystem.

  • We then call new THREE.DDSLoader() instead of the ES-module import.

With this in place, selecting a .dds or .tex file in the “Advanced picker” will now actually decode and draw it into your canvas so you can pick colors from it.

    // FNV-1 hash
    function fnv1(name) {
      let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
      for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
        h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
        h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
      }
      return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
    }

    // Character Name ↔ ID
    function charNameToID() {
      const n = document.getElementById('charName').value;
      document.getElementById('charNameOut').textContent =
        n ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}` : 'Enter a name.';
    }
    function charIDToName() {
      const raw = document.getElementById('charID').value.trim();
      const out = document.getElementById('charIDOut');
      if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
        out.textContent = 'Enter a valid integer ID.'; return;
      }
      const target = parseInt(raw,10);
      const candidates = document.getElementById('charList').value
        .split('\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean);
      const hits = candidates.filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
      out.textContent = hits.length ? hits.join('\n') : 'No matches found.';
    }

    // Dropdown toggle
    function toggleDropdown() {
      document.getElementById('pickerDropdown').classList.toggle('open');
    }

    // Color hex → Tint ID
    function colNameToID() {
      const inp = document.getElementById('colName').value.trim();
      const name = inp.startsWith('#') ? inp : '#' + inp;
      const out = document.getElementById('colNameOut');
      if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
        out.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
      }
      const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i => parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
      const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
      const s = (u & 0x80000000) ? u - 0x100000000 : u;
      out.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
    }

    // ID → Hex + Preview
    function colIDToHex() {
      const raw = document.getElementById('colID').value.trim();
      const out = document.getElementById('colIDOut');
      if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
        out.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
      }
      const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed >>> 0;
      const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0');
      const hex = full.slice(6)+full.slice(4,6)+full.slice(2,4);
      out.innerHTML =
        `${signed} = #${hex}\nPreview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
      document.getElementById('swatch').value = `#${hex}`;
    }

    // DDS/.TEX + standard image loader
    const ddsLoader = new THREE.DDSLoader();
    document.getElementById('imageLoader').addEventListener('change', async e => {
      const file = e.target.files[0];

    // Eyedropper click

You said:
Uncaught TypeError: Failed to resolve module specifier "three". Relative references must start with either "/", "./", or "../". (Also test https://theoneqguy.github.io/Lego-Char-ID-finder/ thats the url)
ChatGPT said:

​You're encountering the error:​

Uncaught TypeError: Failed to resolve module specifier "three". Relative references must start with either "/", "./", or "../".​

This issue arises because your HTML file uses ES module imports like import * as THREE from 'three', which rely on Node.js-style module resolution. However, browsers don't natively support this syntax without additional configuration. As a result, when the browser encounters such imports, it throws the error you're seeing. ​Reddit+2three.js forum+2SBCode+2SBCode

To resolve this, you have a couple of options:

✅ Option 1: Use CDN Scripts (No Modules)

Replace your ES module imports with traditional <script> tags that load the necessary libraries from a CDN. This approach doesn't require any build tools and is compatible with GitHub Pages. Here's how you can modify your HTML:​

html
<!-- Instead of using type="module" and import statements -->
<script src="https://unpkg.com/three@0.154.0/build/three.min.js"></script>
<script src="https://unpkg.com/three@0.154.0/examples/js/loaders/DDSLoader.js"></script>

Ensure that any code relying on THREE is placed after these script tags so that the THREE object is available.​

✅ Option 2: Use an Import Map (Advanced)

If you prefer to use ES module imports, you can define an import map to tell the browser how to resolve module specifiers. This method is more advanced and may not be supported in all browsers. Here's an example of how to set it up:​Medium+2three.js forum+2three.js forum+2

html
<script type="importmap">
{
  "imports": {
    "three": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.154.0/build/three.module.js",
    "three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.154.0/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js"
  }
}
</script>

<script type="module">
  import * as THREE from 'three';
  import { DDSLoader } from 'three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

  // Your code here
</script>

Note that import maps are a newer feature and may not be supported in all browsers. You can check browser compatibility before using this approach. ​

✅ Option 3: Use a Bundler (e.g., Vite, Webpack)

For larger projects or if you plan to use Node.js packages, setting up a bundler like Vite or Webpack is recommended. These tools allow you to write code using ES module imports, and they handle the bundling and module resolution for you. After setting up, you can build your project and deploy the bundled files to GitHub Pages.​

Recommendation:

For simplicity and compatibility with GitHub Pages, Option 1 is the most straightforward. It doesn't require any build tools or advanced configurations. Just ensure that you replace your ES module imports with the appropriate <script> tags as shown.​

If you need assistance modifying your existing code to use this approach, feel free to provide your current HTML file, and I can help adjust it accordingly.

ChatGPT said:

​It appears that the THREE.DDSLoader.parse() method isn't returning the expected texture data, leading to the error:​three.js forum+1GitHub+1

javascript

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'width')

This issue often arises when the .parse() method doesn't return a texture with a defined image property, which can happen if the DDS file format isn't supported or if the file is corrupted.​

✅ Recommended Solution: Use DDSLoader.load() Instead of .parse()

The DDSLoader.load() method is designed to handle DDS files asynchronously and ensures that the texture is fully loaded before you attempt to access its properties.​

Here's how you can modify your code:

javascript
const ddsLoader = new DDSLoader();
const file = e.target.files[0];
if (!file) return;

const url = URL.createObjectURL(file);

ddsLoader.load(url, (texture) => {
  const image = texture.image;
  const w = image.width;
  const h = image.height;
  const imageData = new ImageData(new Uint8ClampedArray(image.data), w, h);

  const canvas = document.getElementById('imageCanvas');
  const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
  canvas.width = w;
  canvas.height = h;

  ctx.putImageData(imageData, 0, 0);
}, undefined, (err) => {
  console.error('Failed to load DDS:', err);
});

This approach ensures that the DDS file is properly loaded and parsed before you attempt to access its properties, preventing the undefined errors you're encountering.​

🛠️ Additional Tips

  • File Format Compatibility: Ensure that your DDS files are in a format supported by DDSLoader. Some DDS files, especially those with DX9/DX10 headers or BC6H compression, may not be supported. ​three.js forum+1GitHub+1

  • Error Handling: Always include error handling in your asynchronous loading functions to catch and handle any issues that arise during the loading process.​

  • Testing: Test your application with various DDS files to ensure compatibility and robustness.​

<script type="importmap">
{
  "imports": {
    "three": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/build/three.module.js",
    "three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js"
  }
}
</script>

<script type="module">
import * as THREE from 'three';
import { DDSLoader } from 'three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

function fnv1(name) {
  let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
  for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
    h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
    h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
  }
  return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
}

window.charNameToID = () => {
  const n = document.getElementById('charName').value;
  document.getElementById('charNameOut').textContent =
    n ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}` : 'Enter a name.';
};

window.charIDToName = () => {
  const raw = document.getElementById('charID').value.trim();
  const out = document.getElementById('charIDOut');
  if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
    out.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
  }
  const target = parseInt(raw,10);
  const candidates = document.getElementById('charList').value
    .split('\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean);
  const hits = candidates.filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
  out.textContent = hits.length ? hits.join('\n') : 'No matches found.';
};

window.toggleDropdown = () => {
  document.getElementById('pickerDropdown').classList.toggle('open');
};

window.colNameToID = () => {
  const inp = document.getElementById('colName').value.trim();
  const name = inp.startsWith('#') ? inp : '#' + inp;
  if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
    document.getElementById('colNameOut').textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
  }
  const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i=>parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
  const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
  const s = (u & 0x80000000)? u-0x100000000 : u;
  document.getElementById('colNameOut').textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
};

window.colIDToHex = () => {
  const raw = document.getElementById('colID').value.trim();
  const out = document.getElementById('colIDOut');
  if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
    out.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
  }
  const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed>>>0;
  const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0');
  const hex  = full.slice(6)+full.slice(4,6)+full.slice(2,4);
  out.innerHTML =
    `${signed} = #${hex}\nPreview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
  document.getElementById('swatch').value = `#${hex}`;
};

const ddsLoader = new DDSLoader();
document.getElementById('imageLoader').addEventListener('change', async e => {
  const file = e.target.files[0];
  if (!file) return;

  const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
  const canvas = document.getElementById('imageCanvas');
  const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');

  if (ext === 'dds' || ext === 'tex') {
    const url = URL.createObjectURL(file);
    ddsLoader.load(url, tex => {
      const img = tex.image;
      const w = img.width, h = img.height;
      const data = new Uint8ClampedArray(img.data);
      const imageData = new ImageData(data, w, h);
      const scale = Math.min(canvas.clientWidth / w, canvas.clientWidth / h, 1);
      canvas.width = w * scale;
      canvas.height = h * scale;
      const off = document.createElement('canvas');
      off.width = w; off.height = h;
      off.getContext('2d').putImageData(imageData, 0, 0);
      ctx.drawImage(off, 0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
    }, undefined, err => {
      console.error('Failed to load DDS:', err);
    });
  } else {
    const img = new Image();
    img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
    await img.decode();
    const w = img.width, h = img.height;
    const scale = Math.min(canvas.clientWidth / w, canvas.clientWidth / h, 1);
    canvas.width = w * scale;
    canvas.height = h * scale;
    ctx.drawImage(img, 0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
  }
});

document.getElementById('imageCanvas').addEventListener('click', e => {
  const c = document.getElementById('imageCanvas');
  const ctx = c.getContext('2d');
  const rect = c.getBoundingClientRect();
  const x = e.clientX - rect.left, y = e.clientY - rect.top;
  const [r,g,b] = ctx.getImageData(x,y,1,1).data;
  const hex = '#' + [r,g,b].map(v=>v.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join('');
  document.getElementById('colName').value = hex;
  colNameToID();
});
</script>

</body>
</html>

Lego-Char-ID-finder/:167 Uncaught (in promise) InvalidStateError: Failed to construct 'ImageData': The input data has zero elements. at Lego-Char-ID-finder/:167:25 at Object.onLoad (three.module.js:40696:19) at three.module.js:40464:38 (anonymous) @ Lego-Char-ID-finder/:167 (anonymous) @ three.module.js:40696 (anonymous) @ three.module.js:40464 Promise.then load @ three.module.js:40452 load @ three.module.js:40654 (anonymous) @ Lego-Char-ID-finder/:163 After loading a dds
ChatGPT said:

The “zero elements” error means that for certain DDS formats (usually compressed texture formats), tex.image.data comes back empty—there’s no raw RGBA you can shove into an ImageData. Three.js’s DDSLoader can load both uncompressed and compressed DDS, but only the uncompressed ones give you a direct image.data array.

To fix this, we need to guard against empty data and gracefully fail (or inform the user) when the DDS is compressed. Here’s the patch:

  1. Check that tex.image.data exists and has length.

  2. Abort (or show an error) if not.

Patch

Find this block in your <script type="module">:

js
ddsLoader.load(url, tex => {
  const img = tex.image;
  const w = img.width, h = img.height;
  const data = new Uint8ClampedArray(img.data);
  const imageData = new ImageData(data, w, h);
  // ...
});

Replace it with:

js
ddsLoader.load(url, tex => {
  const img = tex.image;
  // Only uncompressed DDS provide img.data
  if (!img.data || img.data.length === 0) {
    console.error('DDSLoader: this DDS texture has no raw pixel data (likely compressed).');
    return;  // or display a message to the user
  }

  const w = img.width, h = img.height;
  const data = new Uint8ClampedArray(img.data);
  const imageData = new ImageData(data, w, h);

  const scale = Math.min(canvas.clientWidth / w, canvas.clientWidth / h, 1);
  canvas.width = w * scale;
  canvas.height = h * scale;
  const off = document.createElement('canvas');
  off.width = w; off.height = h;
  off.getContext('2d').putImageData(imageData, 0, 0);
  ctx.drawImage(off, 0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
}, undefined, err => {
  console.error('Failed to load DDS:', err);
});

What this does

  • Verifies that img.data actually contains pixel data.

  • Prevents the new ImageData(...) call from throwing when it’s empty.

  • Logs a clear message to the console so you know the DDS wasn’t usable.

Why compressed DDS fail

Compressed DDS formats (BC1/BC3, etc.) aren’t converted to RGBA in the loader—you’d need a WebGL context and gl.compressedTexImage2D to render them. Handling those requires a full Three.js scene and rendering pipeline, which is beyond the scope of a simple canvas-based eyedropper.

If you need to support compressed DDS, you’d have to:

  1. Create a hidden WebGLRenderer.

  2. Create a DataTexture from the compressed texture.

  3. Render it to a render-target.

  4. Read back the pixels (renderer.readRenderTargetPixels) into an ImageData.

That’s doable but quite a bit more code. Let me know if you want to go down that route—otherwise this guard will stop the errors and keep everything else working.

Below is a complete index.html that:

  • Uses ES modules with an import map for Three.js r149 and DDSLoader.

  • Supports both uncompressed and compressed DDS formats by rendering the DDS texture via a hidden WebGL renderer into a WebGLRenderTarget, then reading back pixels.

  • Keeps your “⌵” dropdown, “Character & Tint ID finder” title, and all existing name/ID and color picker functionality.

Save this as index.html, serve it over HTTP (e.g. python -m http.server), or deploy to GitHub Pages.

<script type="importmap">
{
  "imports": {
    "three": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/build/three.module.js",
    "three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js"
  }
}
</script>

<script type="module">
import * as THREE from 'three';
import { DDSLoader } from 'three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

//
// Helpers
//
function fnv1(name) {
  let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
  for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
    h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
    h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
  }
  return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
}
window.charNameToID = () => {
  const n = charName.value;
  charNameOut.textContent = n
    ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}`
    : 'Enter a name.';
};
window.charIDToName = () => {
  const raw = charID.value.trim();
  if (!/^-?\\d+$/.test(raw)) return charIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.';
  const target = parseInt(raw,10);
  const hits = charList.value
    .split('\\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean)
    .filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
  charIDOut.textContent = hits.length ? hits.join('\\n') : 'No matches found.';
};
window.toggleDropdown = () => pickerDropdown.classList.toggle('open');
window.colNameToID = () => {
  const inp = colName.value.trim();
  const name = inp.startsWith('#') ? inp : '#' + inp;
  if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
    colNameOut.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
  }
  const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i=>parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
  const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
  const s = (u & 0x80000000) ? u-0x100000000 : u;
  colNameOut.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
};
window.colIDToHex = () => {
  const raw = colID.value.trim();
  if (!/^-?\\d+$/.test(raw)) {
    colIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
  }
  const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed >>> 0;
  const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0'),
        hex  = full.slice(6)+full.slice(4,6)+full.slice(2,4);
  colIDOut.innerHTML = 
    `${signed} = #${hex}<br>Preview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
  swatch.value = `#${hex}`;
};

//
// DDS & Image loader
//
const ddsLoader = new DDSLoader();

// Setup WebGL renderer and scene for compressed DDS
const glCanvas = document.getElementById('glCanvas');
const renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer({canvas:glCanvas});
const renderTarget = new THREE.WebGLRenderTarget(1,1);
const orthoCam = new THREE.OrthographicCamera(-1,1,1,-1,0,1);
const scene = new THREE.Scene();
const quad = new THREE.Mesh(
  new THREE.PlaneGeometry(2,2),
  new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial({map:null})
);
scene.add(quad);

imageLoader.addEventListener('change', async e => {
  const file = e.target.files[0];
  if (!file) return;
  const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
  const canvas2D = imageCanvas, ctx2D = canvas2D.getContext('2d');

  if (ext==='dds' || ext==='tex') {
    const url = URL.createObjectURL(file);
    ddsLoader.load(url, texture => {
      // render compressed texture into renderTarget
      quad.material.map = texture;
      const w = texture.image.width, h = texture.image.height;
      renderTarget.setSize(w,h);
      renderer.setRenderTarget(renderTarget);
      renderer.render(scene, orthoCam);
      renderer.setRenderTarget(null);

      // read pixels
      const pixelBuffer = new Uint8Array(w*h*4);
      renderer.readRenderTargetPixels(renderTarget,0,0,w,h,pixelBuffer);

      // draw into 2D canvas
      const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
      canvas2D.width = w*scale;
      canvas2D.height = h*scale;
      const imgData = new ImageData(new Uint8ClampedArray(pixelBuffer), w,h);
      const off = document.createElement('canvas');
      off.width=w; off.height=h;
      off.getContext('2d').putImageData(imgData,0,0);
      ctx2D.drawImage(off,0,0,canvas2D.width,canvas2D.height);
    }, undefined, err=>{
      console.error('DDS load error', err);
    });
  } else {
    const img = new Image();
    img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
    await img.decode();
    const w=img.width, h=img.height;
    const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
    canvas2D.width = w*scale;
    canvas2D.height = h*scale;
    ctx2D.drawImage(img,0,0,canvas2D.width,canvas2D.height);
  }
});

//
// Eyedropper
//
imageCanvas.addEventListener('click', e => {
  const rect = imageCanvas.getBoundingClientRect();
  const [x,y] = [e.clientX-rect.left, e.clientY-rect.top];
  const [r,g,b] = imageCanvas.getContext('2d').getImageData(x,y,1,1).data;
  const hex = '#'+[r,g,b].map(v=>v.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join('');
  colName.value = hex;
  colNameToID();
});

</script>
</body>
</html>

function fnv1(name) {
  let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
  for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
    h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
    h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
  }
  return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
}

  const n = charName.value;
  charNameOut.textContent = n ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}` : 'Enter a name.';
};

window.charIDToName = () => {
  const raw = charID.value.trim();
  if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) { charIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return; }
  const target = parseInt(raw,10);
  const hits = charList.value
    .split('\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean)
    .filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
  charIDOut.textContent = hits.length ? hits.join('\n') : 'No matches found.';

  const inp = colName.value.trim();
  const name = inp.startsWith('#') ? inp : '#' + inp;
  if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
    colNameOut.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
  }
  const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i=>parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
  const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
  const s = (u & 0x80000000) ? u - 0x100000000 : u;
  colNameOut.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;

window.colIDToHex = () => {
  const raw = colID.value.trim();
  if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) { colIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return; }
  const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed>>>0;
  const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0');
  const hex  = full.slice(6) + full.slice(4,6) + full.slice(2,4);
  colIDOut.innerHTML =
    `${signed} = #${hex}<br>Preview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
  swatch.value = `#${hex}`;
};

const glCanvas = document.getElementById('glCanvas');
const renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer({canvas:glCanvas});
const target = new THREE.WebGLRenderTarget(1,1);
const camera = new THREE.OrthographicCamera(-1,1,1,-1,0,1);
const scene = new THREE.Scene();
const quad = new THREE.Mesh(
  new THREE.PlaneGeometry(2,2),
  new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial({map:null})
);

// Image & DDS handling

imageLoader.addEventListener('change', async e => {
  const file = e.target.files[0];
  if (!file) return;
  const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
  const canvas2D = imageCanvas;
  const ctx2D = canvas2D.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true});

  if (ext === 'dds' || ext === 'tex') {
    const url = URL.createObjectURL(file);
    ddsLoader.load(url, tex => {
      const texMap = tex;
      quad.material.map = texMap;
      const w = texMap.image.width, h = texMap.image.height;
      target.setSize(w,h);
      renderer.setRenderTarget(target);
      renderer.render(scene, camera);
      renderer.setRenderTarget(null);

      const pixels = new Uint8Array(w*h*4);
      renderer.readRenderTargetPixels(target, 0,0,w,h, pixels);

      const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
      canvas2D.width = w*scale;
      canvas2D.height = h*scale;

      const imgData = new ImageData(new Uint8ClampedArray(pixels), w, h);
      const off = document.createElement('canvas');
      off.width = w; off.height = h;
      off.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true}).putImageData(imgData,0,0);
      ctx2D.drawImage(off,0,0,canvas2D.width,canvas2D.height);
    }, undefined, err => {
      console.error('DDS load error', err);
    });
  } else {
    const img = new Image();
    img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
    await img.decode();
    const w=img.width, h=img.height;
    const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
    canvas2D.width = w*scale; canvas2D.height = h*scale;
    ctx2D.drawImage(img, 0,0,canvas2D.width, canvas2D.height);
  }
});

// Eyedropper
//

  const rect = imageCanvas.getBoundingClientRect();

I’ve re-integrated the box-sizing fix while preserving every bit of the dropdown, script, and DDS logic from the last working version. Here’s the full index.html—just replace your file with this and it will:

  • Box-size everything so widths line up perfectly.

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <title>Character & Tint ID finder</title>
  <style>
    /* Make width:100% include padding & borders */
    *, *::before, *::after {
      box-sizing: border-box;
    }

    body {
      font-family: sans-serif;
      max-width: 600px;
      margin: 2em auto;
    }
    section {
      border: 1px solid #ccc;
      padding: 1em;
      margin-bottom: 2em;
    }

    /* Full-width controls */
    input[type="text"],
    textarea,

<body>

  <section>
    <h2>Characters IDs</h2>
    <label>Name → ID</label>
    <input id="charName" type="text" placeholder="e.g. IRONMANMARK6" />
    <button onclick="charNameToID()">Get ID</button>
    <pre id="charNameOut"></pre>

    <button onclick="colIDToHex()">Show Hex & Preview</button>
    <pre id="colIDOut"></pre>
  </section>

  <canvas id="glCanvas"></canvas>

  <script type="importmap">
  {
    "imports": {
      "three": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/build/three.module.js",
      "three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js"
    }
  }
  </script>

  <script type="module">
  import * as THREE from 'three';
  import { DDSLoader } from 'three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

  function fnv1(name) {
    let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
    for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
      h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
      h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
    }
    return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
  }

  window.charNameToID = () => {
    const n = charName.value;
    charNameOut.textContent = n
      ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}`
      : 'Enter a name.';
  };

  window.charIDToName = () => {
    const raw = charID.value.trim();
    if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
      charIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
    }
    const target = parseInt(raw,10);
    const hits = charList.value
      .split('\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean)
      .filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
    charIDOut.textContent = hits.length ? hits.join('\n') : 'No matches found.';
  };

  window.toggleDropdown = () => pickerDropdown.classList.toggle('open');

  window.colNameToID = () => {
    const inp = colName.value.trim();
    const name = inp.startsWith('#') ? inp : '#' + inp;
    if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
      colNameOut.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
    }
    const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i=>parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
    const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
    const s = (u & 0x80000000) ? u - 0x100000000 : u;
    colNameOut.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
  };

  window.colIDToHex = () => {
    const raw = colID.value.trim();
    if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
      colIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
    }
    const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed>>>0;
    const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0');
    const hex  = full.slice(6) + full.slice(4,6) + full.slice(2,4);
    colIDOut.innerHTML =
      `${signed} = #${hex}<br>Preview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
    swatch.value = `#${hex}`;
  };

  const ddsLoader = new DDSLoader();
  const glCanvas = document.getElementById('glCanvas');
  const renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer({canvas:glCanvas});
  const target = new THREE.WebGLRenderTarget(1,1);
  const camera = new THREE.OrthographicCamera(-1,1,1,-1,0,1);
  const scene = new THREE.Scene();
  const quad = new THREE.Mesh(
    new THREE.PlaneGeometry(2,2),
    new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial({map:null})
  );
  scene.add(quad);

  imageLoader.addEventListener('change', async e => {
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    if (!file) return;
    const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
    const canvas2D = imageCanvas;
    const ctx2D = canvas2D.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true});

    if (ext==='dds'||ext==='tex') {
      const url = URL.createObjectURL(file);
      ddsLoader.load(url, tex => {
        quad.material.map = tex;
        const w = tex.image.width, h = tex.image.height;
        target.setSize(w,h);
        renderer.setRenderTarget(target);
        renderer.render(scene, camera);
        renderer.setRenderTarget(null);

        const pixels = new Uint8Array(w*h*4);
        renderer.readRenderTargetPixels(target,0,0,w,h,pixels);

        const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
        canvas2D.width = w*scale;
        canvas2D.height = h*scale;

        const imgData = new ImageData(new Uint8ClampedArray(pixels), w,h);
        const off = document.createElement('canvas');
        off.width=w; off.height=h;
        off.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true}).putImageData(imgData,0,0);
        ctx2D.drawImage(off,0,0,canvas2D.width,canvas2D.height);
      }, undefined, err => console.error('DDS load error',err));
    } else {
      const img = new Image();
      img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
      await img.decode();
      const w=img.width, h=img.height;
      const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
      canvas2D.width = w*scale;
      canvas2D.height = h*scale;
      ctx2D.drawImage(img,0,0,canvas2D.width,canvas2D.height);
    }
  });

  imageCanvas.addEventListener('click', e => {
    const rect = imageCanvas.getBoundingClientRect();
    const x = e.clientX-rect.left, y = e.clientY-rect.top;
    const [r,g,b] = imageCanvas.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true})
                  .getImageData(x,y,1,1).data;
    const hex = '#' + [r,g,b].map(v=>v.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join('');
    colName.value = hex; colNameToID();
  });
  </script>

</body>
</html>

This restores the dropdown, keeps everything properly sized, and ensures the character‐list box can only resize vertically with a minimum height. Let me know if it’s all good now!

      <button class="toggle-btn" onclick="toggleDropdown()">
        Advanced picker <span class="triangle">⌵</span>
      </button>
      <div class="dropdown-content">
        <label>Color picker:</label><br/>
        <input type="color" id="colorPicker" class="small-color"
               onchange="colName.value=this.value; colNameToID()" /><br/>
        <label>Image eyedropper:</label><br/>
        <input type="file" id="imageLoader" accept=".dds,.DDS,.tex,.TEX,image/*" /><br/>
        <canvas id="imageCanvas"></canvas>
        <input id="imageSwatch" class="small-color" type="color" disabled />
      </div>
    </div>
    <button onclick="colNameToID()">Get Tint ID</button>
    <pre id="colNameOut"></pre>
    <hr/>
    <label>ID → Hex code + preview</label>
    <input id="colID" type="text" placeholder="e.g. -5744098" />
    <button onclick="colIDToHex()">Show Hex & Preview</button>
    <pre id="colIDOut"></pre>
  </section>

  <canvas id="glCanvas"></canvas>

  <script type="importmap">
  {
    "imports": {
      "three": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/build/three.module.js",
      "three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js": "https://unpkg.com/three@0.149.0/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js"
    }
  }
  </script>

  <script type="module">
  import * as THREE from 'three';
  import { DDSLoader } from 'three/examples/jsm/loaders/DDSLoader.js';

  function fnv1(name) {
    let h = 0x811c9dc5 >>> 0;
    for (let c of name.trim().toUpperCase()) {
      h = Math.imul(h, 0x01000193) >>> 0;
      h ^= c.charCodeAt(0);
    }
    return (h & 0x80000000) ? h - 0x100000000 : h;
  }

  window.charNameToID = () => {
    const n = charName.value;
    charNameOut.textContent = n
      ? `${n.toUpperCase()} = ${fnv1(n)}`
      : 'Enter a name.';
  };

  window.charIDToName = () => {
    const raw = charID.value.trim();
    if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
      charIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
    }
    const target = parseInt(raw,10);
    const hits = charList.value
      .split('\n').map(x=>x.trim()).filter(Boolean)
      .filter(x=>fnv1(x)===target);
    charIDOut.textContent = hits.length ? hits.join('\n') : 'No matches found.';
  };

  window.toggleDropdown = () => pickerDropdown.classList.toggle('open');

  window.colNameToID = () => {
    const inp = colName.value.trim();
    const name = inp.startsWith('#') ? inp : '#' + inp;
    if (!/^#?[0-9A-Fa-f]{6}$/.test(name)) {
      colNameOut.textContent = 'Enter #RRGGBB'; return;
    }
    const [r,g,b] = [1,3,5].map(i=>parseInt(name.slice(i,i+2),16));
    const u = (((255<<24)|(b<<16)|(g<<8)|r)>>>0);
    const s = (u & 0x80000000) ? u - 0x100000000 : u;
    colNameOut.textContent = `${name.toUpperCase()} = ${s}`;
  };

  window.colIDToHex = () => {
    const raw = colID.value.trim();
    if (!/^-?\d+$/.test(raw)) {
      colIDOut.textContent = 'Enter valid ID.'; return;
    }
    const signed = parseInt(raw,10), u = signed>>>0;
    const full = u.toString(16).toUpperCase().padStart(8,'0');
    const hex  = full.slice(6) + full.slice(4,6) + full.slice(2,4);
    colIDOut.innerHTML =
      `${signed} = #${hex}<br>Preview: <input id="swatch" type="color" class="small-color" disabled>`;
    swatch.value = `#${hex}`;
  };

  const ddsLoader = new DDSLoader();
  const glCanvas = document.getElementById('glCanvas');
  const renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer({canvas:glCanvas});
  const target = new THREE.WebGLRenderTarget(1,1);
  const camera = new THREE.OrthographicCamera(-1,1,1,-1,0,1);
  const scene = new THREE.Scene();
  const quad = new THREE.Mesh(
    new THREE.PlaneGeometry(2,2),
    new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial({map:null})
  );
  scene.add(quad);

  imageLoader.addEventListener('change', async e => {
    const file = e.target.files[0];
    if (!file) return;
    const ext = file.name.split('.').pop().toLowerCase();
    const canvas2D = imageCanvas;
    const ctx2D = canvas2D.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true});

    if (ext==='dds'||ext==='tex') {
      const url = URL.createObjectURL(file);
      ddsLoader.load(url, tex => {
        quad.material.map = tex;
        const w = tex.image.width, h = tex.image.height;
        target.setSize(w,h);
        renderer.setRenderTarget(target);
        renderer.render(scene, camera);
        renderer.setRenderTarget(null);

        const pixels = new Uint8Array(w*h*4);
        renderer.readRenderTargetPixels(target,0,0,w,h,pixels);

        const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
        canvas2D.width = w*scale;
        canvas2D.height = h*scale;

        const imgData = new ImageData(new Uint8ClampedArray(pixels), w,h);
        const off = document.createElement('canvas');
        off.width=w; off.height=h;
        off.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true}).putImageData(imgData,0,0);
        ctx2D.drawImage(off,0,0,canvas2D.width,canvas2D.height);
      }, undefined, err => console.error('DDS load error',err));
    } else {
      const img = new Image();
      img.src = URL.createObjectURL(file);
      await img.decode();
      const w=img.width, h=img.height;
      const scale = Math.min(colName.clientWidth*0.66/w, colName.clientWidth*0.66/h,1);
      canvas2D.width = w*scale;
      canvas2D.height = h*scale;
      ctx2D.drawImage(img,0,0,canvas2D.width,canvas2D.height);
    }
  });

  imageCanvas.addEventListener('click', e => {
    const rect = imageCanvas.getBoundingClientRect();
    const x = e.clientX-rect.left, y = e.clientY-rect.top;
    const [r,g,b] = imageCanvas.getContext('2d', {willReadFrequently:true})
                  .getImageData(x,y,1,1).data;
    const hex = '#' + [r,g,b].map(v=>v.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join('');
    colName.value = hex; colNameToID();
    imageSwatch.value = hex;
  });
  </script>

</body>
</html>

Everything should now line up perfectly, the dropdown still works, and the new image‐based color preview updates only when you pick a color from the canvas.

Here are the best options for sharing this entire conversation (including code, formatting, and images) as a scrollable web page, even though it contains an image:

✅ Best Option: "Save Page As..." → Webpage, Complete

  1. In your browser, scroll to the top of this conversation.

  2. Right-click the page and choose “Save As…”.

  3. Set the format to “Webpage, Complete”.

  4. Save the folder + HTML file (e.g., chat.html + chat_files/).

  5. You can now:

    • Share the HTML file with someone.

    • Upload both the .html file and folder to GitHub Pages or another web host.

    • Open it anytime and scroll through the full chat exactly as you see it now—including the image.

✅ Alternative: Convert to PDF with image

If your browser blocks saving images in the normal save:

  1. Press Ctrl+P / Cmd+P to Print.

  2. Choose “Save as PDF”.

  3. Under "More Settings", enable:

    • Background graphics

    • All pages

  4. Save.

Instead of hand-assembling an ever-growing HTML by copy/paste (and inevitably missing things), the simplest way to get exactly this chat—every message, code block, image and all—into a single, scrollable HTML (or self-contained archive) is to let your browser do it for you, with one of these techniques:

1. Use the “SingleFile” Browser Extension

SingleFile (available for Chrome, Firefox, Edge) will crawl the entire page—including images—and bundle everything into one standalone .html:

  1. Install SingleFile from your browser’s extension/add-on store.

  2. Open this chat in the browser, scroll to load all messages.

  3. Click the SingleFile icon → “Save this page”.

  4. It creates a single .html file you can open anywhere and scroll exactly as you see it now.

✔️ Preserves images inline, code formatting, CSS—no missing pieces.
✔️ You can share or host that one file.

2. Print to PDF with Background Graphics

If you just need a shareable document (PDF):

  1. Scroll to the top and make sure the entire chat is loaded.

  2. Press Ctrl+P (Windows) or Cmd+P (Mac) to open Print dialog.

  3. Under “Destination”, choose “Save as PDF”.

  4. In More settings:

    • Check “Background graphics”

    • Set layout to Portrait

    • Make sure All pages are selected

  5. Save.

The resulting PDF includes every chat bubble, image and code block in one scrollable document.

3. “Save Page As…” → “Webpage, Complete”

If SingleFile isn’t an option:

  1. Right-click anywhere → Save As…

  2. Choose “Webpage, Complete”

  3. That gives you an .html plus a folder of assets (.images, CSS).

  4. You can zip both and share.

Why these work better

  • Automated: You don’t miss messages or images.

  • Accurate: The page you see is exactly what you save.

  • Self-contained: SingleFile gives you one HTML, PDF gives you one PDF, “Webpage, Complete” gives you everything to re-open locally.

Give one of these a try, and you’ll have the entire conversation—every user prompt, assistant reply, code block and image—in a single file that anyone can scroll through.
